description: Combining the best of the classic eton mess and peach melba, this easy-to-make meringue recipe with poached peach and raspberries is a delicious sweet treat.
keywords: Pudding,Pescatarian,Seafood free,Low salt,Gluten free,Spring,Nov 2020,Raspberry,Stone fruit,High fibre,Soy free,Wheat free,Vegetarian
name: Poached Peach Melba Mess Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Place vanilla and creme fraiche in a bowl and hand whisk until stiff peaks form. Refrigerate until required.

Place cordial and 3 cups water in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, then bring to the boil. Reduce heat to low and add peaches, ensuring they are in a single layer. Cover with a disc of baking paper to keep peaches submerged in poaching liquid. Poach for 25 minutes or until peaches are tender. Remove pan from heat and cover, then cool for 30 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer peaches to a bowl.
Discard half of the poaching liquid and bring the remainder to the boil over medium-high heat. Cook for 10 minutes or until thickened slightly and syrupy. Set aside to cool.

Halve and destone peaches, then chop into large pieces. Divide creme fraiche mixture and peach among plates. Top with raspberries and meringue. Drizzle over syrup and scatter over pistachios, then serve.
